result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Salvadore Rivas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Counts 1 and 2 DISMISSED but read-in to 15CM832 as to sentencing.

Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing. Court granted Defense's motion to adjourn to allow for the defendant's discharge from a current sentence.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke via telephone. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for bail/bond hearing however, the defendant is no longer in custody. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM035584  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-29-2015

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Salvadore Rivas not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant's appearance waived.  Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel requests a bail/bond hearing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Salvadore Rivas not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced.  Defendant has a pending case in Branch 45.  Defense counsel requests to schedule this case for same date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Salvadore Rivas in court with attorney Bernard S. Stein.  Defendant Salvadore Rivas in custody.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Parties are notified that effective June 8, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Reserve, Branch 45 in Courthouse room 515.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
